titleStmt.title: The English mans doctor. Or the schoole of Salerne Or [ph]ysicall obserua[ti]ons for the perfect preseruing of the bodie of man in continuall health. [Wh]ereunto [is] adioyned precepts for the pr[e]seruation of health. Written by [Hen]ricus Ronsouius for [the p]riuate vse of his sons. And now published for all those that desire to [preser]ue their bodies in [perfect] health.
Regimen sanitatus Salernitatum. English
titleStmt.author: Johannes, de Mediolano.
Harington, John, Sir, 1560-1612.
Hobbes, Stephen, attributed name.
S. H.
Rantzau, Henrik, 1526-1598. De conservanda valetudine liber. English.
Ronsovius, Henricus.

publicationStmt.publisher: [Printed] by William Stansby, for the Widdow Helme, [and] are to be sold at her shoppe in Sa[in]t Dunstanes Church-yard in Fleet-street,

notesStmt.note: Translated in verse by Sir John Harington.

"De valetudine conseruanda, or the preservation of health, .. Collected out of Henricus Ronsouius .. and now published .. By S.H." has separate dated title page and pagination; register is continuous. It is a prose translation, possibly by Stephen Hobbes, of "De conservanda valetudine liber" by Henrik Rantzau.
Imperfect; title page and other leaves torn, with slight loss of print.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: her shoppe in Sa[in]t Dunstanes Church-yard in Fleet-street
